content.description:
This is a dyno/large move variation to

Green Matter

that adds a bit of difficulty. Sit start as for

Green Matter

, but when you get to the pockets, make a large move with your right hand to the crimp high on the face. Top out to the right via jugs.
content.location: Start right and head up the left side of the face, avoiding the arete.

content.description:
Sit start compressing the left arete on a blocky bulge with decent sidepulls. Climb through slopers, and join

Green Matter

to the top.
content.location: It ascends the left side of the face.

content.description: This line follows the right arete of the Green Matter Boulder. Sit start through a series of juggy sidepulls and heel hooks to get you to a juggy topout. This is a great warm-up for the climbs to its left.
content.location: It ascends the right side of the face.

content.description: This is the classic problem on the boulder. Sit start in pockets on the right side of the face, and head up and to the left through a series of amazing pockets. Climb past the green lichen brain, and hit the left arete. Find a decent crimp to the right on the face, and get your left hand up for the last of the difficult moves. A nice selection of jugs and small feet get you to the topout to the right.
content.protection: A few pads. The landing zone is very flat, making for safe falls, even from the top.
content.location: Sit start to the right of the obvious gently overhanging face with a large green brain on it. The downclimb is located to the left, onto another boulder, and then back toward where you began.
